text: thousands beginning to gather here
outside Parliament and they are planning
to stay here really for several hours to
come to coincide with that all-important
parliamentary vote protesters firing
Molotov cocktails police reciprocating a
little with tear gas from these streets
they wanted a better future for their
country this is definitely not what they
had in mind inside Parliament the mood
wasn't any better many MPs are furious
with the Greek Prime Minister for
agreeing to a bailout deal which in
their opinion humiliates their country I
wouldn't admit that the measures we are
tabling a harsh and I don't agree with
them but I also say that I must
implement them there is no other option
and for all of us to share the burden of
this responsibility in the end the vote
passed as expected 228 MPs for and 64
MPs voted against austerity measures is
scarcely any reminder of the angry riots
that took place last night just on the
road a few scorched remnants this was
not an easy bill to get through and it
is the beginning of a very long road now
